parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From ek and haireomai; actively, to tear out; middle voice, to select; figuratively, to release.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

Persecution, affliction, distress, tribulation. From thlibo; pressure.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To offer, give; I put, place. A prolonged form of a primary verb; to give.

Wisdom, insight, skill (human or divine), intelligence. From sophos; wisdom.
Before, in the presence of, in the eyes of. Neuter of enantios; in the presence of.
Pharaoh, the title of ancient Egyptian kings. Of foreign origin; Pharao, an Egyptian king.
A king, ruler, but in some passages clearly to be translated: emperor. Probably from basis; a sovereign.
Egypt. Of uncertain derivation.

str2: From kata and histemi; to place down, i.e. to designate, constitute, convoy.
